title: Update regarding BankOne
story_body:
BankOne's IT Infrastructure Team has completed the rollout of its latest network architecture upgrade, featuring a migration to Cisco's Nexus 9000 series switches across its primary data centers. This enhancement is expected to yield a 30% improvement in packet transmission latency and a 25% increase in overall network throughput.

In personnel news, BankOne has appointed Rachel Lee as its new Vice President of Enterprise Architecture. Ms. Lee joins the company from a similar role at Citigroup, where she oversaw the development of a cloud-based data warehousing platform. Her expertise in data governance and systems integration is expected to be a valuable asset to BankOne's ongoing digital transformation initiatives.

On the marketing front, BankOne has launched a new social media campaign focused on promoting its mobile banking app, which has seen a 20% increase in downloads over the past quarter. The campaign, titled "BankOnTheGo," features a series of targeted ads and influencer partnerships aimed at highlighting the app's user-friendly interface and advanced security features.

In ESG news, BankOne has published its annual Sustainability Report, which highlights the company's progress towards reducing its carbon footprint and promoting diversity and inclusion in the workplace. Notably, the report notes that BankOne has achieved a 15% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions over the past year, thanks in part to its adoption of energy-efficient LED lighting across its branch network. The company has also launched a new employee resource group focused on promoting STEM education and career development opportunities for underrepresented groups.
